properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The display name for the application.

properties.name: homepage
properties.description: • homepage - (optional) The URL to the application's home page. If no homepage is specified this defaults to https://{name}.

properties.name: identifier_uris
properties.description: • identifier_uris - (Optional) A list of user-defined URI(s) that uniquely identify a Web application within it's Azure AD tenant, or within a verified custom domain if the application is multi-tenant.

properties.name: reply_urls
properties.description: • reply_urls - (Optional) A list of URLs that user tokens are sent to for sign in, or the redirect URIs that OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent to.

properties.name: available_to_other_tenants
properties.description: • available_to_other_tenants - (Optional) Is this Azure AD Application available to other tenants? Defaults to false.

properties.name: public_client
properties.description: • public_client - (Optional) Is this Azure AD Application a public client? Defaults to false.

properties.name: oauth2_allow_implicit_flow
properties.description: • oauth2_allow_implicit_flow - (Optional) Does this Azure AD Application allow OAuth2.0 implicit flow tokens? Defaults to false.

properties.name: group_membership_claims
properties.description: • group_membership_claims - (Optional) Configures the groups claim issued in a user or OAuth 2.0 access token that the app expects. Defaults to SecurityGroup. Possible values are None, SecurityGroup or All.

properties.name: required_resource_access
properties.description: • required_resource_access - (Optional) A collection of required_resource_access blocks as documented below.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) Type of an application: webapp/api or native. Defaults to webapp/api. For native apps type identifier_uris property can not not be set.

properties.name: app_role
properties.description: • app_role - (Optional) A collection of app_role blocks as documented below. For more information https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/multitenant-identity/app-roles
<hr/>
required_resource_access supports the following:

properties.name: resource_app_id
properties.description: • resource_app_id - (Required) The unique identifier for the resource that the application requires access to. This should be equal to the appId declared on the target resource application.

properties.name: resource_access
properties.description: • resource_access - (Required) A collection of resource_access blocks as documented below.
<hr/>
resource_access supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: • id - (Required) The unique identifier for one of the OAuth2Permission or AppRole instances that the resource application exposes.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Specifies whether the id property references an OAuth2Permission or an AppRole. Possible values are Scope or Role.
<hr/>
app_role supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: • id - The unique identifier of the app_role.

properties.name: allowed_member_types
properties.description: • allowed_member_types - (Required) Specifies whether this app role definition can be assigned to users and groups by setting to User, or to other applications (that are accessing this application in daemon service scenarios) by setting to Application, or to both.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) Permission help text that appears in the admin app assignment and consent experiences.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Required) Display name for the permission that appears in the admin consent and app assignment experiences.

properties.name: is_enabled
properties.description: • is_enabled - (Optional) Determines if the app role is enabled: Defaults to true.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) Specifies the value of the roles claim that the application should expect in the authentication and access tokens.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: application_object_id
properties.description: • application_object_id - (Required) The Object ID of the Application for which this password should be created. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) The Password for this Application .

properties.name: end_date
properties.description: • end_date - (Optional) The End Date which the Password is valid until, formatted as a RFC3339 date string (e.g. 2018-01-01T01:02:03Z). Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: end_date_relative
properties.description: • end_date_relative - (Optional) A relative duration for which the Password is valid until, for example 240h (10 days) or 2400h30m. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: One of end_date or end_date_relative must be set.

properties.name: key_id
properties.description: • key_id - (Optional) A GUID used to uniquely identify this Password. If not specified a GUID will be created. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: start_date
properties.description: • start_date - (Optional) The Start Date which the Password is valid from, formatted as a RFC3339 date string (e.g. 2018-01-01T01:02:03Z). If this isn't specified, the current date is used. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The display name for the Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: members
properties.description: (Optional) A set of members who should be present in this Group. Supported Object types are Users, Groups or Service Principals.

properties.name: owners
properties.description: (Optional) A set of owners who own this Group. Supported Object types are Users or Service Principals.
NOTE: Group names are not unique within Azure Active Directory.
NOTE: Do not use azuread_group_member at the same time as the members argument.
NOTE: Do not use azuread_group_owner at the same time as the owners argument.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: group_object_id
properties.description: (Required) The Object ID of the Azure AD Group you want to add the Member to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: member_object_id
properties.description: (Required) The Object ID of the Azure AD Object you want to add as a Member to the Group. Supported Object types are Users, Groups or Service Principals. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: The Member object has to be present in your Azure Active Directory, either as a Member or a Guest.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: application_id
properties.description: • application_id - (Required) The ID of the Azure AD Application for which to create a Service Principal.

properties.name: app_role_assignment_required
properties.description: • app_role_assignment_required - (Optional) Does this Service Principal require an AppRoleAssignment to a user or group before Azure AD will issue a user or access token to the application? Defaults to false.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags to apply to the Service Principal.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_principal_id
properties.description: • service_principal_id - (Required) The ID of the Service Principal for which this password should be created. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) The Password for this Service Principal.

properties.name: end_date
properties.description: • end_date - (Optional) The End Date which the Password is valid until, formatted as a RFC3339 date string (e.g. 2018-01-01T01:02:03Z). Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: end_date_relative
properties.description: • end_date_relative - (Optional) A relative duration for which the Password is valid until, for example 240h (10 days) or 2400h30m. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: One of end_date or end_date_relative must be set.

properties.name: key_id
properties.description: • key_id - (Optional) A GUID used to uniquely identify this Key. If not specified a GUID will be created. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: start_date
properties.description: • start_date - (Optional) The Start Date which the Password is valid from, formatted as a RFC3339 date string (e.g. 2018-01-01T01:02:03Z). If this isn't specified, the current date is used. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: user_principal_name
properties.description: (Required) The User Principal Name of the Azure AD User.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: (Required) The name to display in the address book for the user.

properties.name: account_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) true if the account should be enabled, otherwise false. Defaults to true.

properties.name: mail_nickname
properties.description: - (Optional) The mail alias for the user. Defaults to the user name part of the User Principal Name.

properties.name: password
properties.description: (Required) The password for the User. The password must satisfy minimum requirements as specified by the password policy. The maximum length is 256 characters.

properties.name: force_password_change
properties.description: (Optional) true if the User is forced to change the password during the next sign-in. Defaults to false.
